text:
Yo! Got our guests
all settled in.

This is going to be
the easiest money
I've ever made.

- What's with the cookies?
- Fresh baked cookies

are one of the Booker Inn's
signature amenities.

Neil, we don't
have any amenities.

Then what am I
burning my mouth on?

- Oh.
- ( bell rings )

Mr. Jorgensen,
what can we do for you?

Well, first of all,
we love the room.

It's got a real
grandpa aesthetic.

And also, we'd like
to book a snorkel lesson.

Snorkel lesson?
Uh-huh. Just one moment.
Yo, we offer snorkel lessons?

Booker, we are one
of San Francisco's

premiere boutique
lodging destinations.

Our amenities
are what separate us
from our competition.
We don't have any competition.
Yes, and with that attitude,

someone's going to be
employee of the month.

- Boop.
- ( bell rings )

Hi, my wife would
like to sign up
for the Mexican cooking class.
Ah, very good, sir.

Would you like
the Four Course Fiesta

or the Eating La Vida Loca
package?

- Neil, a word?
- Un momento, por favor.

What else did
you put in our ad?

- Turndown service?
- Mm-hmm.

Mud baths?
'70s throwback disco-size?
All the top hotels do it.

We have to if we're
going to stay competitive.

We are not a real hotel.
I'm just in this for the money.

My dad says that's
the worst reason

to get into
the hospitality business.

- It's hard work.
- ( bell rings )
It wasn't supposed to be.
